title: Tim Grendell
added: In December of 2019, Grendell told election officials that he planned to retire before his term ended so that if re-elected, he could receive both a salary of over $150,000 and a pension, both funded by taxpayers. This practice is commonly known as “double dipping.”<ref>{{Cite web|date=2020-04-17|title=Grendell Informs Election Officials He’s Retiring, Opening Door to ‘Double Dipping’ {{!}} Geauga County Maple Leaf|url=https://www.geaugamapleleaf.com/news/grendell-informs-election-officials-hes-retiring-opening-door-to-double-dipping/|access-date=2021-02-01|website=www.geaugamapleleaf.com|language=en-US}}</ref>
